text: Cordova hitched to Angular....   looks pretty solid.  <http://ionicframework.com/>

attachments.text: Ionic makes it incredibly easy to build beautiful and interactive mobile apps using HTML5 and AngularJS.
attachments.fallback: Ionic makes it incredibly easy to build beautiful and interactive mobile apps using HTML5 and AngularJS.

text: wow
Yes. Posted this 3 weeks back. Love this thing.
hah...  guess I missed that Gaston.   you can claim "first"
No, no. That came out wrong. I meant to say (write) that's awesome. Excitement prevents me from making sense. :weary:
You obviously can still use grunt, but they seem to be on the gulp wagon
Whats with these gross framework names these days?
Gulp and Guzzle and Grunt
Yes, gulp is starting to take over.
WTF, nerds?
Like something from a kid's book. "Gulp, Guzzle, and Grunt were gorgeous grizzly bears."
I've been exploring loopback this morning - and they are very angular friendly...   they have a grunt task that will generate angular services for all models in your loopback API
services that do what?
crud?
So similar to dpd.js you get a js file to load in your Angular frontend client that let you directly access the API as angular resources...
oh i see
so whatever you define...  Like for a user model.   that has a /users/login endpoint.    in Angular you can then do Users.login(credential, success(), failture())
that’s nice
<http://docs.strongloop.com/display/DOC/AngularJS+JavaScript+SDK>
although i didn’t really have a problem just making a service for all the requests when we were using flask
<!channel> Do we have a crashlytics account? Should we get one? Also: Crittercism
+1 for crashlytics
I can set up Crittercism - they emailed me today about setting it up
Lets get that set up.
who would want to be on that call?
<@U0261PCRQ> - you're doing crashlytics
<@U026NB2U2>: <@U02895311> <@U0289USNA> <@U0261PCRQ> and me for the call. Early next week?
also had a good call w. <http://keen.io|keen.io> today - I think they'd be good for IOTAS analytics
A crittercism guy was stalking me 3 or four weeks ago, I said I was busy but interested and told him to follow-up with me the next week - but I never heard anything again.
i took the call
he blasted a few of us :grinning:
I assumed so.  glad you took the call
i already did an initial screen to make sure it wasn't bs
it's not - it's actually really cool
I did homework online to see what they were about... and it seemed atleast worth hearing them out.
also keep minds open for crashlytics
Not to add more variables to the mix but I've been hearing a lot of good things about Newrelic. Haven't used them and don't know the cost but just putting out there in case that helps in any way.
always good to have variables
Agreed.
<@U02618EV1>: Crittercism is NewRelic's main competition.
Crashlytics recently came out with a TF like beta dist system as well
NewRelic has been around forever...  doing Ruby/Rails performance tracking...  I have no clue how long they been doing mobile performance tracking.
<https://keen.io/docs/SDKs/>

attachments.title: Keen IO - Analytics for Developers
attachments.text: Keen IO is a set of powerful APIs that allow you to collect, analyze, and visualize events from anything connected to the internet.
attachments.fallback: Keen IO: Keen IO - Analytics for Developers
